conbody.p: This chapter covers using the MiramoPDF DITA-OT plugin and the GUI template designer, MiramoDesigner, to produce custom PDFs from DITA content. It includes information on using MiramoDesigner to customize a Miramo Format Definitions (MFD) template together with information on using ant build parameters and @outputclass attributes to customize the appearance of PDF output.

The plugin includes a default MFD template which can be used to publish DITA out of the box, either via your CMS, or using the MiramoPDF output transformation (oXygen) or deliverable (XMetaL), or via a simple command line interface. If the default template suits your needs, you can skip to . For information on using the command line interface see .
